the bank or the Ganges. There he lives in all the splendor

elephants, trained to the sport or tiger hunting. Several
times a year, mounted on one or these powerful and sagacious
animals, and attended by his servants, he makes excursions
into the adjacent country, and, attacking the tiger in his native jungle, drives him from his retreat, and 'mid the exulting
yells of the native population, forces his untameoble nature to
yield sovereignty to man. A tiger hunt is an occasion of no

missiles, to assist, if it be necessary, in his extermination.
